body:
I'm trying to build `libx11@1.6.7`, and compilation failing in `configure` stage because of the flags in `compilers.yaml` as mentioned below, is there anyway exclude flags for only `libx11@1.6.7` and NOT its dependencies? OR anyway get it to compile.

```console
$ spack install libx11@1.6.7
```

### Platform and user environment

Please report your OS here:
```commandline
$ uname -a 
Linux btlogin1 2.6.32-754.23.1.el6.x86_64 #1 SMP Tue Sep 17 09:46:55 EDT 2019 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
$ lsb_release -d
Description:	Red Hat Enterprise Linux Server release 6.10 (Santiago)
``` 

- `compilers.yaml`

```
- compiler:
    paths:
      cc: /sw/spack-rhel6/gcc-7.4.0-cy4dcv/bin/gcc
      cxx: /sw/spack-rhel6/gcc-7.4.0-cy4dcv/bin/g++
      f77: /sw/spack-rhel6/gcc-7.4.0-cy4dcv/bin/gfortran
      fc: /sw/spack-rhel6/gcc-7.4.0-cy4dcv/bin/gfortran
    operating_system: rhel6
    target: x86_64
    modules: []
    environment: {}
    extra_rpaths: []
    flags:  
      cflags: -O2 -g -march=native -mavx2
      cppflags: -O2 -g -march=native -mavx2
      fflags: -O2 -g -march=native -mavx2
      cxxflags: -O2 -g -march=native -mavx2
    spec: gcc@7.4.0

```

to the issue
